journal-title-group.journal-title: Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics

publisher.publisher-name: American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

title-group.article-title: Characterizing and Generating Bivariate Empirical Rank Distributions Satisfying Certain Positive Dependence Concepts

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1993 American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: This article introduces an approach for characterizing the classes of empirical distributions that satisfy certain positive dependence notions. Mathematically, this can be expressed as studying certain subsets of the class S<sub>N</sub> of permutations of 1,...,N, where each subset corresponds to some positive dependence notions. Explicit techniques for iteratively characterizing subsets of S<sub>N</sub> that satisfy certain positive dependence concepts are obtained and various counting formulas are given. Based on these techniques, graph-theoretic methods are used to introduce new and more efficient algorithms for constructively generating and enumerating the elements of various of these subsets of S<sub>N</sub>. For example, the class of positively quadrant dependent permutations in S<sub>N</sub> is characterized in this fashion.
